intro: Platystephium, commonly known as the "Australian bellflower," is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. These plants are typically shrubs or subshrubs with simple, often hairy leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are usually blue, purple, or white and are arranged in racemes or umbels. Platystephium species are adapted to dry environments and are often found in sandy or rocky soils. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
